definition: to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Those unable to attend the funeral are asked to send flowers。
sentences.chinese: 不能現場出席葬禮的人士可以在網站獻花。

sentences.english: Pilgrims no longer come to leave notes or flowers.
sentences.chinese: 朝聖者也不再來此留言或獻花。

sentences.english: The orchestra played three flourishes for him and he was presented with flowers.
sentences.chinese: 樂隊三度吹奏對他表示感謝，還有人向他獻花。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, in Guangzhou, where the company set up an office just months ago, Google employees said that they hadn’t received any flowers from Chinese Web users.
sentences.chinese: 廣州谷歌剛剛成立幾個月，他們說還沒收到網民獻花。

sentences.english: Sure. It was moving that students presented flowers to their teachers。
sentences.chinese: 當然，學生們給老師獻花的場景真讓人感動。

sentences.english: The campaign soon spread to other parts of the country.
sentences.chinese: 獻花行動很快在其他地區傳開。

sentences.english: Of course, none of their followers had asked for any flowers on their own initiative.
sentences.chinese: 當然，任何跟班都未主動向接待方要求爲其主人獻花。

sentences.english: A girl presented him with a bouquet on his arrival.
sentences.chinese: 在他抵達時，一個女孩向他獻花。

sentences.english: The flowers belonged by right to the florists.
sentences.chinese: 鮮花當然由獻花女捧着。

sentences.english: This flower-girl now offered her blossom to the soul.
sentences.chinese: 這個獻花女現在只向靈魂獻出她的花朵了。

sentences.english: Two middle aged women on their way to worship the Great leader.
sentences.chinese: 兩個中年婦女在去給故宅獻花的路上。

definition: to inflate/to pump up/fig. to encourage/to boost morale
to visit (a patient, prisoner etc)/to look inquiringly
sufferer/a victim of a calamity/a person in distress
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
